definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
lit. Sichuan dogs bark at the sun (idiom); fig. a simpleton will marvel at even the most common things/alludes to the Sichuan foggy weather where it's uncommon to see a sunny day
Ayurveda (ancient Indian system and health care philosophy)/also written 阿育吠陀[a1 yu4 fei4 tuo2]
Ayurveda (ancient Indian system and health care philosophy)

sentences.english: The bark of the muntjac was believed to waken the sun.
sentences.chinese: 人們相信山羌的吠叫聲可以喚醒太陽。

sentences.english: The Bark Control Collar effectively and humanely stops all barking when it is worn.
sentences.chinese: 只有在佩戴止吠項圈時，它纔會有效的阻止狗狗吠叫。

sentences.english: I sometimes go shopping in Dragon Bay.
sentences.chinese: 我有時在龍吠過程中去買東西。

sentences.english: A fearless little chair, that barks but doesn't bite.
sentences.chinese: 一張無畏的小椅子，它會吠卻不咬人。

sentences.english: Sb, the hope of humanity, Liberty Enlightening the World.
sentences.chinese: 黴利堅，犬類的希望，吠吠世界。

sentences.english: Sb, the hope of humanity, Liberty Enlightening the World.
sentences.chinese: 黴利堅，犬類的希望，吠吠世界。

sentences.english: My father's bark is worse than his bite.
sentences.chinese: 我家老頭兒吠得比咬得更兇。

sentences.english: Elephant keeps moving while dogs bark.
sentences.chinese: 狗在吠的同時，印度象仍保持前進。

sentences.english: The dog yelped when the guy stepped on his tail.
sentences.chinese: 尾巴被踩着時，狗兒痛得吠了一聲。

sentences.english: It walked along the wall of the house and barked.
sentences.chinese: 它沿着屋子牆邊走，而且一邊吠着。

sentences.english: Have you ever wondered why do dogs bark?
sentences.chinese: 你可曾想過犬緣何而吠呢？

sentences.english: Apart from the barking, the arrangement suits me fine.
sentences.chinese: 除了吠叫聲外，這種安排還蠻適合我的。

sentences.english: Suddenly my dog spit at the door.
sentences.chinese: 突然，我的狗朝着門低吠起來。

sentences.english: It came again. The deep voice rang loud and clear in the frosty night.
sentences.chinese: 它又吠了一聲，低沉的吼聲在寒夜裏格外清晰。

definition: cry of a crane or wild goose
to cry/to weep aloud/to crow/to hoot
to nod one's head and wag one's tail (idiom)/to be well pleased with oneself/to have a lighthearted air
